name: prysm-validator
description: Launches an Ethereum validator client that interacts with a beacon chain, starts proposer and attester services, p2p connections, and more.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator accounts
subcommands.description: Defines commands for interacting with Ethereum validator accounts.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator accounts backup
subcommands.description: backup accounts into EIP-2335 compliant keystore.json files zipped into a backup.zip file at a desired output directory. Accounts to backup can also be specified programmatically via a --backup-for-public-keys flag which specifies a comma-separated list of hex string public keys

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Path to a directory where accounts will be backed up into a zip file.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing the desired password for your backed up accounts.
Comma separated list of public key hex strings to specify which validator accounts to backup.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator accounts delete
subcommands.description: deletes the selected accounts from a users wallet.

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Comma separated list of public key hex strings to specify which validator accounts to delete.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator accounts import
subcommands.description: imports Ethereum validator accounts stored in EIP-2335 keystore.json files from an external directory

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing a password for a validator account.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing a hex string representation of a private key to import.
Path to a directory where keystores to be imported are stored.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator accounts list
subcommands.description: Lists all validator accounts in a user's wallet directory

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Beacon node RPC provider endpoint.
Comma separated list of key value pairs to pass as gRPC headers for all gRPC calls. Example: --grpc-headers=key=value

Integer to define max receive message call size (in bytes). If serving a public gRPC server, set this to a more reasonable size to avoid resource exhaustion from large messages. Validators with as many as 10000 keys can be run with a max message size of less than 50Mb. The default here is set to a very high value for local users.
Number of attempts to retry gRPC requests.
Amount of time between gRPC retry requests.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Lists validator indices.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Displays the private keys for validator accounts.
Certificate for secure gRPC. Pass this and the tls-key flag in order to use gRPC securely.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator accounts voluntary-exit
subcommands.description: Performs a voluntary exit on selected accounts

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing a password for a validator account.
Beacon node RPC provider endpoint.
Exits all validators. This will still require the staker to confirm a userprompt for the action.
Output directory to write voluntary exits as individual unencrypted JSON files. If this flag is provided, voluntary exits will be written to the provided directory and will not be broadcasted.
Exits without displaying the confirmation prompt.
Comma separated list of key value pairs to pass as gRPC headers for all gRPC calls. Example: --grpc-headers=key=value

Integer to define max receive message call size (in bytes). If serving a public gRPC server, set this to a more reasonable size to avoid resource exhaustion from large messages. Validators with as many as 10000 keys can be run with a max message size of less than 50Mb. The default here is set to a very high value for local users.
Number of attempts to retry gRPC requests.
Amount of time between gRPC retry requests.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Number of validators to deterministically generate. Example: --interop-start-index=5 --interop-num-validators=3 would generate keys from index 5 to 7.

Start index to deterministically generate validator keys when used in combination with --interop-num-validators. Example: --interop-start-index=5 --interop-num-validators=3 would generate keys from index 5 to 7.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Comma separated list of public key hex strings to specify on which validator accounts to perform a voluntary exit.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Certificate for secure gRPC. Pass this and the tls-key flag in order to use gRPC securely.
Comma separated list of public keys OR an external url endpoint for the validator to retrieve public keys from for usage with web3signer.
URL for consensys' web3signer software to use with the Prysm validator client.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.
show help

subcommands.name: prysm-validator db
subcommands.description: Defines commands for interacting with the Prysm validator database.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator db convert-complete-to-minimal
subcommands.description: Convert a complete EIP-3076 slashing protection to a minimal one

options.description: show help
Source data directory
Target data directory

subcommands.name: prysm-validator db migrate
subcommands.description: Defines commands for running validator database migrations

subcommands.name: prysm-validator db migrate down
subcommands.description: Runs down migrations for the validator database

options.description: Data directory for the databases.
show help

subcommands.name: prysm-validator db migrate up
subcommands.description: Runs up migrations for the validator database

options.description: Data directory for the databases.
show help
show help

subcommands.name: prysm-validator db restore
subcommands.description: restores a database from a backup file

options.description: show help
Filepath to the backed-up database file which will be used to restore the database
Target directory of the restored database
show help

subcommands.name: prysm-validator slashing-protection-history
subcommands.description: Defines commands for interacting your validator's slashing protection history.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator slashing-protection-history export
subcommands.description: exports your validator slashing protection history into an EIP-3076 compliant JSON

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Data directory for the databases.
(Experimental): Enables the minimal slashing protection. See EIP-3076 for more details.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Allows users to specify the output directory to export their slashing protection EIP-3076 standard JSON File.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator slashing-protection-history import
subcommands.description: imports a selected EIP-3076 compliant slashing protection JSON to the validator database

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Data directory for the databases.
(Experimental): Enables the minimal slashing protection. See EIP-3076 for more details.
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Path to an EIP-3076 compliant JSON file containing a user's slashing protection history.
show help

subcommands.name: prysm-validator wallet
subcommands.description: Defines commands for interacting with Ethereum validator wallets.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator wallet create
subcommands.description: creates a new wallet with a desired type of keymanager: either on-disk (imported), derived, or using remote credentials

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Kind of keymanager, either imported, derived, or remote, specified during wallet creation.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
(Advanced) Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing a 25th word passphrase for your mnemonic for HD wallets.
/path/to/ca.crt for establishing a secure, TLS gRPC connection to a remote signer server.
/path/to/client.crt for establishing a secure, TLS gRPC connection to a remote signer server.
/path/to/client.key for establishing a secure, TLS gRPC connection to a remote signer server.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Allows for skipping the check for a mnemonic 25th word passphrase for HD wallets.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator wallet recover
subcommands.description: uses a derived wallet seed recovery phase to recreate an existing HD wallet

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
show help
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
(Advanced) Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing a 25th word passphrase for your mnemonic for HD wallets.
File to retrieve mnemonic for non-interactively passing a mnemonic phrase into wallet recover.
Number of accounts to generate for derived wallets.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Allows for skipping the check for a mnemonic 25th word passphrase for HD wallets.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.
show help

subcommands.name: prysm-validator web
subcommands.description: Defines commands for interacting with the Prysm web interface.

subcommands.name: prysm-validator web generate-auth-token
subcommands.description: Generate an authentication token for the Prysm web interface

options.description: Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
show help
Host on which the HTTP server runs on.
Port on which the HTTP server runs on.
Path to auth token file used for validator apis.
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
show help
Accepts Terms and Conditions (for non-interactive environments).
Specifies the timeout value for API requests in seconds.
Fixes validator can attest timely after current block processes. See #8185 for more details.
Beacon node REST API provider endpoint.
Beacon node RPC provider endpoint.
Turns on block profiling with the given rate.
Path to a YAML file with chain config values.
Prompt for clearing any previously stored data at the data directory.
Filepath to a yaml file with flag values.
Writes CPU profile to the given file.
Data directory for the databases.
Output directory for db backups.
Disables prometheus metrics for validator accounts. Operators with high volumes of validating keys may wish to disable granular prometheus metrics as it increases the data cardinality.
Disables monitoring service.
Disables reward/penalty logging during cluster deployment.
To enable the use of prysm validator client in Distributed Validator Cluster
(Advanced): Specifies the time duration the validator waits to reload new keys if they have changed on disk. Can be any type of duration such as 1.5s, 1000ms, 1m.
Enables the E2E testing config, only for use within end-to-end testing.
(Experimental): Enables of the beacon REST API when querying a beacon node.
Enables builder validator registration APIs for the validator client to update settings such as fee recipient and gas limit. This flag is not required if using proposer settings config file.
Serves HTTP handler to initiate database backups. The handler is served on the monitoring port at path /db/backup.

Enables the validator to perform a doppelganger check. This is not a foolproof method to find duplicate instances in the network. Your validator will still be vulnerable if it is being run in unsafe configurations.
(Experimental): Enables the minimal slashing protection. See EIP-3076 for more details.
Enables the pruning of the validator client's slashing protection database.
Enables request tracing.
Clears any previously stored data at the data directory.
String to include in proposed blocks.
Path to a YAML file with graffiti values.
Comma separated list of key value pairs to pass as gRPC headers for all gRPC calls. Example: --grpc-headers=key=value

Integer to define max receive message call size (in bytes). If serving a public gRPC server, set this to a more reasonable size to avoid resource exhaustion from large messages. Validators with as many as 10000 keys can be run with a max message size of less than 50Mb. The default here is set to a very high value for local users.
Number of attempts to retry gRPC requests.
Amount of time between gRPC retry requests.
Runs Prysm configured for the Holesky test network.
Comma separated list of domains from which to accept cross origin requests (browser enforced).
Host on which the HTTP server runs on.
Port on which the HTTP server runs on.
Number of validators to deterministically generate. Example: --interop-start-index=5 --interop-num-validators=3 would generate keys from index 5 to 7.

Start index to deterministically generate validator keys when used in combination with --interop-num-validators. Example: --interop-start-index=5 --interop-num-validators=3 would generate keys from index 5 to 7.
Path to auth token file used for validator apis.
Specifies log file name, relative or absolute.
Specifies log formatting. Supports: text, json, fluentd, journald.
Runs on Ethereum main network. This is the default and can be omitted.
Turns on memory profiling with the given rate.
Runs Prysm configured for the Mekong test network.
Uses minimal config with parameters as defined in the spec.
Host used for listening and responding metrics for prometheus.
Port used to listening and respond metrics for Prometheus.
Turns on mutex profiling with the given rate.
Enables the pprof HTTP server.
pprof HTTP server listening interface.
pprof HTTP server listening port.
Sets path to a YAML or JSON file containing validator settings used when proposing blocks such as fee recipient and gas limit. File format found in docs.
Sets URL to a REST endpoint containing validator settings used when proposing blocks such as fee recipient and gas limit. File format found in docs.
Enables the RPC server for the validator client (without Web UI).
Host on which the RPC server should listen.
RPC port exposed by a validator client.
Runs Prysm configured for the Sepolia test network.
Slasher node RPC provider endpoint.
Certificate for secure slasher gRPC. Pass this and the tls-key flag in order to use gRPC securely.

Sets ALL validators' mapping to a suggested eth address to receive gas fees when proposing a block. Note that this is only a suggestion when integrating with a Builder API, which may choose to specify a different fee recipient as payment for the blocks it builds.For additional setting overrides use the --proposer-settings-file or --proposer-settings-url flags.
Sets gas limit for the builder to use for constructing a payload for all the validators.
Certificate for secure gRPC. Pass this and the tls-key flag in order to use gRPC securely.
Writes execution trace to the given file.
Indicates what fraction of p2p messages are sampled for tracing.
Tracing endpoint defines where beacon chain traces are exposed to Jaeger.
Name to apply to tracing tag process_name.
A file path used to load remote public validator keys and persist them through restarts.
Comma separated list of public keys OR an external url endpoint for the validator to retrieve public keys from for usage with web3signer.
URL for consensys' web3signer software to use with the Prysm validator client.
Sets the maximum size for one batch of validator registrations. Use a non-positive value to disable batching.
Logging verbosity. (trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, panic)
Path to a wallet directory on-disk for Prysm validator accounts.
Path to a plain-text, .txt file containing your wallet password.
(Work in progress): Enables the web portal for the validator client.
(Danger): Writes the wallet password to the wallet directory on completing Prysm web onboarding. We recommend against this flag unless you are an advanced user.
